sentence.Network_en: You've had another opportunity to try to stupefy me.
sentence.Network_cn: 你还会有机会来愚弄我的.

sentence.Network_en: Revives someone, especially someone who has had Stupefy cast on them.
sentence.Network_cn: 让人苏醒的咒语, 尤其是对中了麻木咒的人有奇效.

sentence.Network_en: To stupefy with or as if with alcoholic drink.
sentence.Network_cn: 使烂醉因或似因喝了酒而头脑发呆.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from French stupéfier, from Latin stupefacere, from stupere 'be struck senseless'

entry.tran: 使震惊;使惊呆;使惊愕;使神志不清
entry.def: If something stupefies you, it shocks or surprises you so much that you cannot think properly for a while.

example.ex: ...a violent slap on the side of the head, which stunned and stupefied him.
example.tran: 他的一边脑袋上猛地挨了一掌，使他顿时觉得晕头转向，昏天黑地

means.word_mean: 1. make dull or stupid or muddle with drunkenness or infatuation
2. be a mystery or bewildering to;
3. make senseless or dizzy by or as if by a blow;

auth_sentence.content: The temptation to stupefy himself with drink was almost irresistible.
auth_sentence.res_content: The temptation to stupefy himself with drink was almost irresistible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The temptation to stupefy himself with drink was almost irresistible.

auth_sentence.content: Ointments...that stupefy and enchain our senses.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ointments...that stupefy and enchain our senses.

auth_sentence.content: The reason he immersed himself in sports, he once told me, was to stupefy himself, to stop himself from thinking.
auth_sentence.res_content: The reason he immersed himself in sports, he once told me, was to stupefy himself, to stop himself from thinking.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The reason he immersed himself in sports, he once told me, was to stupefy himself, to stop himself from thinking.

sentences.en: He was stupefied at the news.
